title:
Exploiting nonequilibrium phase transitions and strong symmetries for
  continuous measurement of collective observables
authors: Albert Cabot, Federico Carollo and Igor Lesanovsky
abstract:
Dissipative many-body quantum dynamics can feature strong symmetries which
give rise to conserved quantities. We discuss here how a strong symmetry in
conjunction with a nonequilibrium phase transition allows to devise a protocol
for measuring collective many-body observables. To demonstrate this idea we
consider a collective spin system whose constituents are governed by a
dissipative dynamics that conserves the total angular momentum. We show that by
continuously monitoring the system output the value of the total angular
momentum can be inferred directly from the time-integrated emission signal,
without the need of repeated projective measurements or reinitializations of
the spins. This may offer a route towards the measurement of collective
properties in qubit ensembles, with applications in quantum tomography, quantum
computation and quantum metrology.
